posts.post_content: Really nice artwork. Nice to see some more uncontrollable vampires that Sorin needs to put in place. Strong threat since its flying especially in limited. Posted By: Gabriel422 (1/29/2012 11:45:54 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card is Tier 1. definitely. 4/1 haste for 4 mana, even without survivabiity, would have once broken the power curve, and is still an enormous threat. And the indestructibiliy bonus is the kind of ability that lets you laugh off sweepers, removing from your mind the question whether an opponent is holding one. If no sweeper has gone off yet, your board is full, and you can cast this without losing it. If a sweeper has gone off, you're safe to play your hastie. On top of what it is as a creature, you have a terriffic sac outlet, which a lot of flavors of black can make use of in itself.  
  
One mistake people are making when evaluating the strength of this card is reading the "human" clause too strongly. You don't have to play humans with this card. In fact, you should definitely play vamps insetad, with cards like Bloodghast and Kalastria Highborn. WIthout any humans at all, you still have a virtually indestructible 4/1 flying, haste. I'd imagine the "sacrifice a human" claus... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
This card is Tier 1. definitely. 4/1 haste for 4 mana, even without survivabiity, would have once broken the power curve, and is still an enormous threat. And the indestructibiliy bonus is the kind of ability that lets you laugh off sweepers, removing from your mind the question whether an opponent is holding one. If no sweeper has gone off yet, your board is full, and you can cast this without losing it. If a sweeper has gone off, you're safe to play your hastie. On top of what it is as a creature, you have a terriffic sac outlet, which a lot of flavors of black can make use of in itself.

One mistake people are making when evaluating the strength of this card is reading the "human" clause too strongly. You don't have to play humans with this card. In fact, you should definitely play vamps insetad, with cards like Bloodghast and Kalastria Highborn. WIthout any humans at all, you still have a virtually indestructible 4/1 flying, haste. posts.post_content:
DISCLAIMER: THE PROS PLAY THIS WITHOUT ANY HUMANS IN THIER DECK  
  
the true value of this is that the ability doesnt require a human for the idestutibility making this preaty hard to kill; spot removal twords this guy means you can sack a lesser guy instead, same with mass removal, some thing like vapor snag isnt that bad because this has haste. the only things that can remove this when you have other creatures are -1/-1's and exiling both of wich are faily uncomon in standard right now.  
  
in my opinion, this is the sleeper hit of DKA

posts.post_content: I'm so torn with all these red vamps. I have a vampire tribal that has all the big power houses: [Vampire Nocturnus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Nocturnus), [Captivating Vampire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Captivating Vampire), [Bloodline Keeper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodline Keeper), [Kalastria Highborn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kalastria Highborn), and many more of the useful vamps. Now where I'm torn is this card here, [Olivia Voldaren](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Olivia Voldaren), and [Stromkirk Captain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stromkirk Captain). They are all awesome and I'm sooo tempted to splash in red. I would have to fork out some cash for some good duel lands because I hate lands that come out tapped, so I would have to get cards like [Blood Crypt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blood Crypt) to keep the speed up, and I'm a little hesitant to put another 4cmc creature in there, right now the only thing that costs that much to cast is Bloodline Keeper... so realistically I would probably only throw in like 3 or 4 Stromkirk Captains and 1 or 2 Olivia's... but is that even worth it? Or should I make a whole new vamp deck that works on different ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
